g.text: Preparing the Primary for Standby Servers
continuous archiving on the primary to an archive directory accessible from the standby
set up authentication on the primary server
to allow replication connections from the standby server(s)
The archive location should be accessible from the standby even when the primary is down
CREATE USER replicator WITH REPLICATION LOGIN ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'replicator';
# Allow the user "foo" from host 192.168.1.100 to connect to the primary
# as a replication standby if the user's password is correctly supplied.
standby server can connect to the replication pseudo-database
provide a suitable entry or entries in
Replication slots provide an automated way to ensure that the primary does not remove WAL segments
until they have been received by all standbys
postgres=# SELECT slot_name, slot_type, active FROM pg_replication_slots;
limits the size of WAL files retained by replication slots
specifies the maximum number of replication slots
a file exists in the data directory when the server is started.
Set to a simple command to copy files from the WAL archive
fill in with a libpq connection string
to use the replication slot, should be configured on the standby.
